result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason Lee Wotsch

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jason Lee Wotsch not in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Jason Lee Wotsch.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Issues with transportation from group home, defendant could not appear. Parties remain in DPA resolution posture. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on September 1st, 2022

Defendant Jason Lee Wotsch in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Jason Lee Wotsch.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defense is in receipt of discovery and offer. Case may be in DPA posture. TAD evaluation to be completed. 
Case adjourned.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jason Lee Wotsch in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has not received discovery and an offer from the state and requests additional time.
Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 13.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders. Court orders that all mental health treatment conditions be followed.

Defendant Jason Lee Wotsch in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Jason Lee Wotsch in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jason Lee Wotsch appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   
This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
